triplets: Large domesticated mammal adapted to arid environments, known for its humps used for fat storage
Transport of goods and people, providing milk, meat, and wool, tourism (camel rides), and as pack animals in desert regions
Legs adapted for walking on sand
Brown, Gray, Beige, or mixtures depending on species and region
Desert ecosystems, domesticated livestock, cultural heritage in arid regions
Not applicable; naturally occurring species and domesticated by humans
Approximately 1.8–2 meters at shoulder; 2–3 meters including head and humps
Typically 40–50 years in captivity; shorter in wild or harsh conditions
